text.*:
Mining Area
Auxilliary Base Construction Area
Neo-Neo-colonialism is go!
Obvious exits South to Arrivals
Purpose Build a base/house for Lavaland
Access level Construction
Noteworthy contents materials, tools
Clearance Captain, Head of Personnel, Chief Engineer, Engineer, Atmospheric Technician, Head of Security, Engineering Security Officer, Curator
Security level Low
Style Unfinished
Balance Requirements
Other Notes
Locations on /tg/station


Located above the arrivals shuttle, this is where the crew can build a base for Lavaland. Once you are happy with what you have built, have the miners activate their special beacon at the desired landing zone and punch in the teleportation sequence on the big blue computer. Wa-la! It's free real estate! Now put on some internals and colonize! Kill the local fauna and indigenous population, start a cannabis plantation on the fertile volcanic soil, create even more bases with the help of engineering!

But, be careful! The untamed lavaland is prone to ashstorms! You will need roofs to shield you from the blazing ashes! How to build roofs you ask? Simple, delineate an area with the Chief Engineer's blueprint.


Construction Time

Here you can utilise a highly advance, remote controlled, RCD Drone to rapidly construct a base from scratch. This RCD Drone is fully equipped with a expanded supply of RCD matter charges, and is capable of quickly building a large suite of structures.

The RCD Drone can construct the following


  • Standard compliment of walls, airlocks and windows.
  • Up to four 'fans', these fans prevent air from being sucked out into Lavaland from a open airlock. The fan should be placed after a airlock has been placed.
  • Up to four defence turrets. These turrets will fend off local wildlife. They will only deal full damage if exposed to the outside pressure of Lavaland, and as such should be placed outside the base.

The base also comes with the following unique equipment

  • Shuttle Dock - This, when activated, will allow the Mining Shuttle to land at the beacon anywhere on Lavaland. So long as it does not crash into the Aux Base.

Deployment

In order to deploy a Aux Base onto Lavaland a Miner first has to activate a Landing Beacon where they want it to land, this device is found inside any Miner Personal Locker. Once placed a warning will be sent to the station that a drop point has been deployed, and the base can be sent at any time.

In order to send the actual base, someone has to physically interact with the console at the centre of the Aux Base, after a few moments this will launch the base down to the beacon.

Note that a intrepid crew can launch multiple Auxiliary Bases, this can allow a crew to link up multiple buildings and create a large, and sprawling, Auxiliary Base.
